page.title: 16PETTYPOOL LAKE, WHITEGATE
page.content: Pettypool is mainly woodland, full of wildlife and insects. There is a large lake with wooden jetties used for fishing and sailing. Guides, Cubs and Scouts camp at Pettypool. The only access is by walking down a long path through the trees but this is very beautiful. No cars can go through the wood so it is safe for children. The lake and trees are surrounded by Sandiway Golf Club course and fields. The fields belong to Pettyypool farm, which is close by. The Golf Club has pumping equipment and is allowed to use some of the water from the Pettypool Lake to water the golf greens. The area is an important conservation area and has been kept in its natural state. There are no facilites available but the farm can be of use to campers.
